results.description:
Cafe Philo

Address: No.3, Shaoxing N. St., Zhongzheng Dist., Taipei City

Open data, source, design, science, standards, licensing, maps, geodata, hardware, culture...!

In the model of our public #OpenDataLDN meetups in London, UK, the global Open Knowledge Foundation network invites all Finnish advocates of open knowledge to our first meetup to meet one another and create a road map for open data in the region.

In the broadest sense of the word, 'open knowledge' means everything from genes to geodata, from literature to source code. In an age of digital communication, we believe that nations gain considerable social benefits in the fields of administration, science, culture and finance by using this knowledge together.

Finland has traditionally had a strong culture of open knowledge and sharing. This meetup aims to bring actors together from different areas of this field to share plans and aspirations. We also hope to identify new ideas for collaboration among these communities. 

Participants are encouraged to prepare a short introduction on their history with open knowledge and to identify problems they wish the community to help them tackle.

This event is free of charge, but please RSVP here so we know you are coming.

Programme:

15.00 Welcome speech 
15.15 Introduction of Open Knowledge Foundation, Kat Braybrooke 
15.30 Introductory round - aspirations and proposals 
16.30 Wrap-up - the need for further measures 
17.00 Informal brainstorming and cooperation

Further information: http://fi.okfn.org/
Chat about this Meetup on Twitter using the hashtags #opendataFI (English) and #avoindata (Finnish).

2 day event Saturday 3rd & Sunday 4th

http://www.opendataday.org

blog post in german language by Daniel Dietrich
http://okfn.de/2011/11/offene-geodaten-berlin-wir-fangen-dann-schon-mal-an%E2%80%A6/

For one day only we'll have a crack team of coders including representation from the CKAN and OpenSpending teams ready to break data out of its internet prisons and load it into theDataHub.org for you to use.

If you can't make it in person, join us via IRC: irc.freenode.net, #okfn (Webclient: http://bit.ly/irc-okfn)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

During the Day, LONDON Challenges you to 3 challenges: 

1. The CKAN Challenge: 

# How can I join in? 

## Have a dataset in mind that you need to get hold of in machine-readable format? 

Let us know what you are looking for via the form below. Then, if you can, swing by on the day to keep us company with witty chat while we try and get it for you. We'll try and get as many datasets as possible released in one day.

If we don't get them all done, we'll organise a speed-geeking event in the near future to try and complete them. 

## Coder / Data Wrangler? 

We need you! If you can screen scrape have data wrangling abilities, come along (either virtually or in person) to hang out, drink good coffee and wrangle. 

2. The OpenSpending Challenge: 

http://www.opendataday.org/wiki/OpenSpending

3. The IATI Challenge: 

http://www.aidinfolabs.org/archives/773
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

# Registration

1. Register via this meetup page...

2. Let us know which datasets you would like to see: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/viewform?formkey=dG4yMzE5YVpDZ0hYNDE3VVk2RjNkREE6MQ

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

The CKAN team will also be there to help anyone who is interested in building extensions to CKAN, the open source open data platform!

The pad for the event is here: http://ckan.okfnpad.org/opendataday?

results.description:
On Saturday 28th January we're getting together for an Open Economics Hackday a one-day gathering to build and research 'cool stuff' related to a economics (usually of a digital variety) in under 24 hours.

Meeting up in London and online, we'll be wrangling data and building apps all day. Whether you're a social scientist, student, coder or just someone with an interest there will be something for you to do: just be prepared to dive in and help build something.


Where: London (The Barbican) and Online (so you can join from anywhere in the world)
Who: Anyone! Coder, data wrangler, economists, illustrator or writer?

Etherpad: http://econ.okfnpad.org/hackathon-jan-2011
Contact us: http://openeconomics.net/contact/

As with all hackdays, exactly what gets work on gets decided on the day (you can add suggestions to the etherpad). However, one particular idea, which we could become a submission to Apps4Italy, is set out below at http://openeconomics.net/hackday-january-2011/.
results.venue_name: The Barbican - www.barbican.org.uk, Meet us at the public space coffee area in the main hall on floor G

results.description:
Want to get involved with open knowledge communities in London? 

#OpenDataLDN is a bi-monthly, participatory series that gives Londoners working in a variety of fields (including academia, science, hardware, design, programming, media, government, development and culture) the opportunity to engage with a diverse network of locals interested in open access, free culture and content. Our first two meetups packed the house with great energy and new faces, so we're hoping to carry that positive momentum on to the new year for our third installment.

This month, we'll meet over drinks at the Centre for Creative Collaboration to hear Oliver Keyes talk about the future of the Wikimedia movement regarding remixed data, and you'll also have the opportunity to discuss and share your own initiatives. 

We also have confirmed lightning talks for discussion:

1) 'From here to there' - an open data transport project that will reveal how much it costs to get around, with Julian Tate from Open Data Manchester.
2) 'National Archives hackday' - a call for participants, collections & ideas about how to engage with the public domain, with Jo Pugh from the UK National Archives.
3) 'Landscape-Portrait' - a video-focused collaboration between artists and communities that combines qualitative and quantitative data to understand local demographics, with Kevin Carter from the University of Westminster.
4) 'Open economics' - a call for contributions, cooperation and participation from a new working group focused on working with open economic data and social science, with Velichka Dimitrova from the University of Cambridge.
5) 'Prism: A sculptural aggregator of live data in London' - a new installation is being planned at the V&A for London Design Festival 2012 that will use urban data to present an interactive reading of the city. The designer, Keiichi Matsuda, is looking for ideas regarding how to implement and work with open data.

Join us for a night of new friends and inspiring discussions! On Twitter? Talk to other participants now with the hashtag #OpenDataLDN.
Open Project Organization XIII, "Team Architect's Initiative"

More information on: http://wiki.okfn.org/Chapter/Belgium

Join us in the Panton Arms for the second #OpenDataCBG meet-up. A friendly and informal evening for people in Cambridge to get together and talk about open data.

## Give a lightning talk!

Lightning talks are informal 2-3 minute presentations on any topic. 

Confirmed so far:

Jurgi Cristobal - JIDC
Greg Hadfield - Open Data Cities Conference
Peter Murray-Rust - Open @ccess
Rufus Pollock - Recline Data Explorer

Whatever you're interested in - government, science, cultural heritage, hardware, design, transport, or something else entirely! - come and meet like-minded people eager to discuss your ideas and share their own.

On Twitter? Talk to other participants using the #OpenDataCBG hastag.

On Saturday 3rd March we're getting together for the Energy and Climate Hackday to data-wrangle and build apps around energy and climate data. All skills and interest groups are welcome: developer, data journalist, economist, climate scientist, environmentalist or an interested citizen.

* When: Saturday 3rd March, 11am GMT (12pm CET/6am EST) to ~7pm GMT (8pm CET/3pm EST)
* Where: Online (IRC, Skype) and also in person in London - ThoughtWorks Ltd., 9th Floor Berkshire House, 168-173 High Holborn, London, WC1V 7AA
* Who: Anyone! All skills are necessary and welcomed: coding, writing, illustrating, climate modelling or having concerns about the environment?

http://openeconomics.net/2012/02/14/energy-and-climate-hackday/

Lunch and drinks sponsored by AMEE and space provided by ThoughtWorks.

http://wiki.okfn.de/OKberlinmeeting/13032012

We are very happy to invite everyone to our next Open Berlin Meeting which will start at 6 p.m. at Oberholz Ko-Working Space (Rosenthaler Straße 72, 10119 Berlin).

Nannette Schliebner will present the Open Knowledge Index - a tool to measure openness in different countries.

The projects description:

The Open Knowledge Index has been designed to measure and track progress in opening up information, data and knowledge in a broader sense to the public. The Open Knowledge Index captures three dimensions of knowledge ? the ability to access knowledge (capability), the availability of knowledge and data provision (legislation) and the capacity to use the data and feed it back into the open data eco-system (open society).

The parliamentary research service of the German Bundestag provides high class research on relevat topics in the policy discourse. They are publicly funded, however only a small portion of them are accessible to the public at large. The Open Knowledge Foundation and Frag den Staat now provide an easy way to ask for studies that have been handed out to individuals but may not be published due to copyright claims. For more information see here and here.

Afterwards everyone can have the floor to discuss current projects and ideas or just have a beer together.

You can attend the event on Lanyrd. If you want to tweet about it please use #openberlin

If somebody wants to do a bigger presentation just drop me an email at hauke.gierow@okfn.org See you Tuesday!

Hauke 

http://lanyrd.com/2012/openberlin/

...Interested in Open Knowledge? 
...Want to meet others who are?
Look no further! OKFN and DevCSI are arranging the first Meet-up in Scotland right here in Auld Reekie, with the Open Biblio project team taking the helm.

OKFN Meet-ups are friendly and informal evenings for people to get together and talk about open data. London and Cambridge have had huge successes, with like-minded people getting together to share, discuss and argue all elements of openness, and now it's time for Edinburgh to join the party.

We already have guest speakers lined-up to do lightening talks (informal 2-3 minute presentations) on the Public Domain Review, the Open Data Handbook and CKAN, as well as Open Biblio; if you would like to talk about a particular area of Open Data or related subjects - whether a project you're involved with already or your aspirations for the future of openness - then get in touch! naomi.lillie [@] okfn.org.

#OKFN 
#OpenData
#OpenDataEDB

results.description:
Für besseren Verkehr dank offener Daten! 

Die Schweiz pulsiert im Rhythmus der Verkehrsadern: Strasse und Bahn, Velofahrer, Automobilisten und ÖV-Benutzer erzeugen nicht nur grosse Mengen von Daten, ihr Verhalten wird auch massgeblich durch diese gesteuert ? Verkehrsleitsystemen und Echtzeitfahrplänen sei Dank. An einem so genannten Mobility Hackday (http://make.opendata.ch) will make.opendata.ch Ende März das Innovationspotential ausloten.

Mobilitätsdaten sind eine gefragte Grundlage für technologische Innovationen wie politische Entscheidungsprozesse. Anders als in andern Ländern sind sie in der Schweiz aber allzu oft nicht öffentlich verfügbar oder frei verwendbar ? für ein Land mit einer verkehrstechnischen Ingenieurstradition wie der Schweiz ein Kuriosum. Seit einiger Zeit beginnt sich die Situation jedoch zu ändern: Softwareentwickler und Designer, Mobilitätsplaner und andere Experten arbeiten mehr und mehr an offenen Systemen für besseren Verkehr.

Am 30. und 31. März treffen sich zeitgleich in Zürich (http://yellow.local.ch/de/8003/Falcone) und in Genf (http://www.hesge.ch/head) im Rahmen der zweiten make.opendata.ch-Hackdays Gestalter, Denker und Macher, um zusammen der Frage nachzugehen, wie sich mit offenen Daten einfachere, freundlichere oder praktischere Nutzungsmöglichkeiten unserer Verkehrsinfrastruktur erschliessen lassen. In kurzen Referaten und offenen Workshops werden Mobile Apps, Visualisierungen, Webapplikationen und Mashups konzipiert und entwickelt, gemeinsam von Nutzern, Anbietern und Experten. Die Veranstaltung unter Mitwirkung der SBB und von http://internet-briefing.ch ist kostenlos.

Jetzt anmelden!

Die Veranstaltung dauert von Freitag 9 Uhr bis Samstag 17 Uhr. Um frühzeitige Anmeldung wird gebeten: http://make.opendata.ch/doku.php?id=resource:signup-2012-spring

Make.opendata.ch ist eine Veranstaltung des Vereins http://www.opendata.ch, hervorgegangen aus einer Initiative von http://www.ch-open.ch und http://www.s-i.ch

Kontakt Deutschschweiz: andreas.amsler <ät> opendata.ch

OKFN Greece Meet-up program

1. Kaitlyn Braybrooke (OKFN Local Chapter and Groups Coordinator), Open Knowledge Foundation Scope-Vision, OKFN: Local Groups and Chapters. (15-20 minutes)

2. Dr. Charalampos Bratsas, (OKFN Greece Local Group Coordinator) Greek Open Data and the OKFN Greece challenges (15 minutes)

3. Prof. I. Antoniou (Director of MSc Web Science, AUTH, Steering Committee OKFN Greece). The power of Openness. Open Data and Open Knowledge (15 minutes)

4. Prof. George Metakides (President of DIGITAL ENLIGHTENMENT FORUM, Steering Committee OKFN Greece). Open Data Infrastructures for Innovation (15 minutes)

5. Prof. Spirakis Paul G. (Director of Computer Technology Institute and Press "Diophantus", Steering Committee OKFN Greece). Open Data and Evolutionary Games (15 minutes)

6. Dr. Sören Auer (OKFN Advisor Board, LOD2 EU project Coordinator) Linked Data Challenges LOD2 Project Results (15 minutes)

7. Marinos Papadopoulos (Legal Lead Creative Commons Hellas), Openness through the Creative Commons licenses (15 minute)

8. Prof. Panagiotis Bamidis (meducator EU Project Coordinator, Steering Committee OKFN Greece) Open Educational Data: the case of meducator project. (15 minutes)

9. Kostantinos Stampoulis (Greek Wikipedia Administrator), Towards Greek Wikimedia Foundation (15 minutes)

10. Discussion 30 minutes

11. Greek Wine Reception.


Google map: http://maps.google.gr/maps/place?cid=15378852460087723486&q=%CE%9A%CF%84%CE%AF%CF%81%CE%B9%CE%BF+%CE%B5%CF%80%CE%B9%CF%84%CF%81%CE%BF%CF%80%CE%AE%CF%82+%CE%B5%CF%81%CE%B5%CF%85%CE%BD%CF%8E%CE%BD+%CE%91%CE%A0%CE%98&hl=el&ved=0CBsQ-gswAA&sa=X&ei=NHJrT7XlJsmh8gOluqGPDA&sig2=ksdzhrMr0BnpPUcmDoDMLA

results.description:
Na próxima quinta-feira, 19h de abril, às 20h30, Rufus Pollock, um dos fudadores da Open Knowledge Foundation, e Helen Darbishire, uma das fundadoras da Access Info, debatem sobre dados abertos e acesso à informação na Matilha Cultural, em São Paulo.

O evento: Com a sanção da lei de acesso a informação pública no Brasil no final de 2011 após longos anos de debate e pressão da sociedade civil, instituições públicas de todas esferas passaram a correr atrás dos longos anos de espera e estão começando a publicar seus dados em formato aberto. Com a presença de um dos fundadores das organizações sem fins lucrativos Open Knowledge Foundatione Acess Info, Rufus Pollock e Helen Darbishire, respectivamente, debateremos o que de melhor está ocorrendo sobre esses temas no mundo e como o Brasil poderá avançar para um maior acesso à informações públicas e porque esses dados precisam ser abertos. O debate será mediado pelo coordenador de comunidades da Open Knowledge Foundation no Brasil, Everton Zanella Alvarenga, e pelo coordenador de projetos do Artigo 19 no Brasil, Arthur Massuda.

Mais informações: http://br.okfn.org/2012/04/12/rufus-pollock-e-helen-darbishire-debatem-dados-abertos-e-acesso-a-informacao-na-matilha-cultural/

Vagas limitas: 70 participantes
Inscrições pelo link http://tinyurl.com/rufus-helen
results.venue_name: Matilha Cultural, Rua Rego Freitas, 542  São Paulo
results.short_description: Rufus Pollock e Helen Darbishire debatem dados abertos e acesso à informação

results.description:
National Congress Open Data Eindhoven, April 20.
It is time to apply Open Data into practice! We know that there is data overflow, so now we have to convert it into usable information. By bringing together vision and practice, usage of datasets visualization becomes a serious business. How? Come to the National Congress Open Data and make a jump into the future of Open Data!

What?
With the title Make it work the Platform Open Data Eindhoven organizes the National Congress Open Data congress on Friday, April 20th. The conference focuses on the practical application of Open Data. Besides several great speakers, there will be a varied afternoon program with interactive parallel sessions. Case studies, visual and digital presentations will immediately provide you with instant applicable knowledge, inspiration and dialogue.

Where and when?
In Eindhoven, on 20th April 2012, in the city hall of Eindhoven on Stadhuisplein 10, about 10 minutes walk from the Central station.

For whom?
For everybody that is interested in Open Data, both providers and (potential) users. Main target groups: governments, business, knowledge hubs and citizens.

Keynote-speakers
Adam Greenfield: passionate American, keynote speaker of the day. This writer and visionary (Beyond the Smart City ) on April 20th tells about the importance of Open Data in perspective of tomorrows city;
Frederik Ruys: Data Journalist, Designer of Above Netherlands;
Paul Suijkerbuijk: Project Manager of Open Data Overheid.nl, ICTU;
Brenno de Winter: Publicist, Journalist of the year 2011.
results.short_description: Congress: experience and learn Open Data practices and visions

* Hashtag: #okfnbr
results.short_description: Pizza, Cerveja & Dados Abertos - Open Knowledge Foundation Brasil

results.description:
Vamos dar início ao Papos com Dados no dia 28 de abril para discutir os maiores problemas de São Paulo.

* Transporte
* Segurança
* Saúde

Se você tem ideias para ajudar a melhorar problemas do transporte (metrô lotado, congestionamentos absurdos, sistema de ônibus ineficiente, desrespeito aos pedestres e ciclitas), segurança (pontos de assalto, locais com má iluminação e sequestros relâmpago) e saúde (filas nos hospitais, mal atendimento, erro médico entre outros), venha participar da primeiro Papo com Dados  organizado pela Open Knowledge Foundation Brasil e pela Transparência Hacker!

Traga sua listinha de problemas da cidade de São Paulo e forma de resolvê-las que você pensou. Vamos tentar usar o potencial dos dados disponíveis e tentar documentar dados que estão faltando para criar aplicativos e visualizações que tentem ajudar os cidadãos de São Paulo a ajudarem a resolver colaborativamente seus problemas.

Veja mais: http://br.okfn.org/2012/04/21/papo-com-dados-os-maiores-problemas-de-sao-paulo/
results.short_description: Papo com Dados: os maiores problemas de São Paulo

From Mai 2nd to 4th we will meet at 18:15 CEST in Wikimedias re:publica tent. This is a great chance to meet and catch up with the Open Knowledge People around.

Join us again in the Panton Arms for another#OpenData meet-up: a friendly and informal evening for people in Cambridge to get together and talk about open data.

## Give a lightning talk!

Lightning talks are informal 2-3 minute presentations on any topic.

## Confirmed so far:

* Tom Oinn - Overtone
* Velichka Dimitrova - YourTopia 
* Sarah Burge - Science and Wikipedia
* Kat Braybrooke - OKFestival 2012

To give a talk, just email laura.newman [@] okfn.org.

Whatever you're interested in - government, science, cultural heritage, hardware, design, transport, or something else entirely! - come and meet like-minded people eager to discuss your ideas and share their own.

On Twitter? Talk to other participants using the #OpenDataCBG hastag. 
Questions? Email laura.newman [@] okfn.org

Hope to see you there!

OKFN Meet-ups are friendly and informal evenings for people to get together and talk about open data. Join us to share ideas, compare projects and develop plans.

Talks planned so far include the topics of crowdsourcing and
education, the challenge of linking data together, and DM2E.

If you would like to give a lightning talk (informal 2-3 minute presentations) contact naomi.lillie [@] okfn.org.

http://openbiblio.net/2012/05/08/opendataedb-2-16th-june/

#OpenDataEDB

Join Open Knowledge Foundation co-founder Rufus Pollock and other data wranglers for an informal evening of good conversation and hacking over drinks after Future Everything.

We'll show you some of our coolest data tools (including http://CKAN.org, http://Yourtopia.net and http://OpenSpending.org) and you can show us what local projects you've been working on. 

You'll also meet the Open Design Working Group's co-founders (http://design.okfn.org), who will be creating their first Open Design Definition at Saturday's FAB* Summit (http://ow.ly/aQLyw).  

We look forward to learning more from Manchester's open data communities together. Have a project you want us to look at ahead of time? Leave it in the comments!

PS. Thanks to @OpenDataMCR's Julian Tate and Steven Flower for venue help! Details here: http://www.britonsprotection.co.uk/

Ci vediamo al cafe del Chiostro del Bramante (http://chiostrodelbramante.it/) per parlare di open data ed conoscenza aperta, e per parlare di alcuni progetti attivi al momento.

Brevi presentazioni di ciò che sta succedendo (2 o 3 minuti) sono benvenute! Condividi questo evento,  incontra altre persone interessate al mondo open data e scopri attività interessanti nella tua zona!

Velichka Dimitrova, Project Manager of Open Economics, presenterà i progetti su cui è attivo al momento il gruppo di lavoro per raccogliere suggerimenti e idee.

An informal meetup following "Data tools for NGOs workshop at HUB Prague".

Come to share your thoughts & experience with workshop, discuss your #opendata related plans and meet the community in "real" life! Especially welcome are those, who would like to join us in establishing a Czech chapter of Open Knowledge Foundation (http://cz.okfn.org/)

More about the workshop:

Takes place at Hub Prague (Drtinova 10, Praha 5) on 31st of May from 13:15 to 17:30. Free entry.
Topics: Crowdsourcing, data driven journalism, google tools and many more. For more info and registration please contact Miroslav Hyrman: miroslav.hyrman@osf.cz
results.short_description: Data tools workshop for NGOs - Afterparty

results.description:
Hack4Europe! is a series of hack days organised by the Europeana Foundation and its partners and provides an exciting environment to explore the potential of open cultural data for social and economic growth in Europe.

More information: http://okfn.de/2012/04/hack4europe-2012-berlin/

#BiblioHack http://bit.ly/KQdy62 is coming to London on June 13th and 14th, and we invite you as hackers, coders, data enthusiasts and interested members of the public to come and hang out with its participants over drinks!

This hackathon, open to anyone interested in working with and learning about metadata, aims to bring together software developers, project managers, librarians and experts in a variety of fields related to open bibliographic data. 

At #BiblioHack, we'll be building and working with tools that enable people and institutions to get the most of bibliographic data, and this meetup is a chance for #BiblioHack participants and interested friends to share projects and meet one another in an informal setting before the hacking starts.

With a core crew of folk involved in the Open Knowledge Foundations Working Group on Open Data in Cultural Heritage and Open GLAM, the Open Biblio project, the DM2E project and DevCSI, we look forward to an interesting night of #BiblioHack discussion, drinks and new ideas!

Venue: http://www.creativecollaboration.org.uk/where.php

#BiblioHack
Will discuss the short-term agenda to establish OKFN-Japan. Talks will be in Japanese, but most of attendees can understand English (I guess).
results.short_description: Preliminary meeting for establishing OKFN-Japan Chapter

results.description:
On the eve of the OpenData.ch 2012 conference (http://opendata.ch/2012/) we're holding an informal meetup to talk about open data and open knowledge.

Interested in open data and open knowledge communities in Zurich and Switzerland then come along!

The Co-Founder and Director of the Open Knowledge Foundation, Rufus Pollock, will be in town and attending this meetup.
http://in.okfn.org/

Informal first meetup to discuss open data generally and especially in regard to anything affecting Blackpool.
Ideas, suggestions for particular discussions welcome.
Email me at info@blackpoolview.co.uk
Looking forward to seeing you there.
results.address1: Ruskin Hotel, 55-61 Albert Rd, Blackpool, FY1 4PW

results.description:
Beers and OPEN data. 
¿Hay q crear un OKFN Spain?
¿Hay muchos o pocos datos públicos?
¿Se puede vivir de los datos abiertos?
¿Que hacemos con las AAPP q no publican?
¿Cual es la mejor app que usa opendata?

 Con unas cerves seguro q decidimos. :-D

For anyone interested in Open Data in Bangalore.

Whether you are interested in Open Government Data, Open Science, Data Driven Journalism, Open Education - or something else entirely! - come along and find out more.

A chance to talk to others with similar interests in your area, and to find out what is going on in the open data movement across the world.

Lucy Chambers and Laura Newman are travelling in India and Would love to meet fellow open data enthusiasts - and enthusiasts to be...!

A ideia do Hub OKFn é montar, como parte das atividades da Open Knowledge Foundation no Brasil, um grupo de hackers, desenvolvedor@s, advogad@s e comunicador@s para implementar tecnologias livres em pequenos municípios, departamentos de governo e organizações não-governamentais.

O foco inicial (que obviamente podendo ser rediscutido) esta nas implementações de alguns sistemas livres a serem adaptados:

*CKAN - Catálogo de Dados Abertos (já usado no Dados.Gov.Br)
*OpenSpending - Visualização de informação orçamentária
*Alaveteli - Sistema de Pedidos de informação (já usado no Queremos Saber)
*Alaveteli 2 - Sistema de comunicação com parlamentares (um fork, que já está sendo adaptado para uma ONG na Sérvia)

A ideia desse primeiro encontro é discutir a formatação desse grupo e uma agenda de trabalho para os próximos meses.

Um encontro informal para quem tem interesse no tema dos dados e do conhecimento aberto em Sao Paulo. Apareca para conhecer pessoas, ideias e projetos que tenham a ver com abertura e compartilhamento. Converse com colaboradores e colaboradoras da comunidade que esta se formando no Brasil, e descubra formas de participar também!

* Evento aberto e gratuito (mas nao deixe de confirmar presenca nesta pagina!) 
* Pizza e cerveja para todos! Cortesia da OKFN ;) 
* Hashtag: #okfnbr

For anyone interested in Open Data in Mumbai. 

Whether you are interested in Open Government Data, Open Science, Data Driven Journalism, Open Education - or something else entirely! - come along and find out more.

A chance to talk to others with similar interests in your area, and to find out what is going on in the open data movement across the world.

Lucy Chambers and Laura Newman are travelling in India and would love to meet fellow open data enthusiasts - and enthusiasts to be...!

Full address: 

Pinstorm
Swati Bldg
Ground Floor, 
b/h Kotak Bank, 
Off Linking Rd, 
North Avenue, 
Santacruz West, 
Mumbai-54

Our number: 07406658790

TENTATIVE AGENDA (We're flexible and these are just suggestions, please feel free to add!)

* Introductions 
* 3 minute lightning talks (who is working on what projects?) 
* Discussion on what open data is? What it means for India... 
* What are the most desirable datasets for your aims (and how do you get them)? 
* Action plan - how do we keep the discussion going? 
* [SUGGESTIONS FROM YOU!]

Contact phone: 7406658790

Cameron Neylon, one of the worlds greatest advocates of open science is in Cape Town. Science is undergoing a data revolution and there is more data generated in science today than can possibly be worked on by the scientists generating the data. This is the time to go the Open Science route: to make the most of the data that has been generated and make scientific discovery within reach of all scientists.

* Please bring R30 to contribute to pizza and refreshments 
* Hashtag: #OpenMeetupCT
results.short_description: Open Knowledge evening broadly themed Open Science

results.description:
O PoliGNU convida a todas e todos para nosso primeiro encontro no semestre relativo ao Projeto Radar Parlamentar (http://radarparlamentar.polignu.org).

A proposta deste encontro é pensar em melhorias e novos recursos que podem existir no sistema.
Além disso, pensar em possibilidades de interação entre essa ferramenta e o pessoal "técnico" com outras áreas do conhecimento, como Ciências Sociais e jornalismo.

Por fim, será feito um planejamento das próximas atividades do projeto.

Todas as pessoas são muito bem vindas!
results.venue_name: Escritório Piloto - sala S-33 do prédio da Engenharia Civil da Escola Politécnica da USP, na Cidade Universitária (Butantã)

results.description:
No sábado, 25 de agosto, vamos ter a segunda edição do Papos com Dados organizado pela Open Knowledge Foundation Brasil e pela Transparência Hacker! Desta vez o encontro será sediado na Ação Educativa e a conversa, é claro, sobre dados educacionais. 

No primeiro encontro falamos sobre os maiores problemas de São Paulo, especialmente sobre transporte, segurança e saúde. Dá para saber mais aqui: http://br.okfn.org/2012/04/21/papo-com-dados-os-maiores-problemas-de-sao-paulo/

A ideia do evento é simples: conversar com especialistas que conheçam ou trabalhem com dados de educação para ter um panorama geral de quais são as informações disponíveis, como obtê-las e as possíveis dificuldades encontradas nesse processo. 

O encontro pode servir de ponto de partida para a criação de aplicativos, matérias jornalísticas e, até mesmo, para a mobilização em torno da liberação de dados não disponíveis.


*Saiba mais sobre a Ação Educativa: http://www.acaoeducativa.org/
This will be the first OKFN meetup in Copenhagen.

Um encontro informal para quem tem interesse no tema dos dados e do conhecimento aberto em Santos. Apareça para conhecer pessoas, ideias e projetos que tenham a ver com abertura e compartilhamento. Converse com colaboradores e colaboradoras da comunidade que esta se formando no Brasil, e descubra formas de participar também!

* Evento aberto e gratuito (mas nao deixe de confirmar presenca nesta pagina!)
* Pizza e cerveja para todos! Cortesia da OKFN ;)
* Hashtag: #okfnbr

Non-students are welcome to take a peek and to mentor the students where needed. Please RSVP as we need to have an estimate of the number of people who want Pizza at noon.

Students, researchers and just graduated students, are welcome to participate in the hackathon. More information on http://appsforflanders.be. If you participate in the hackathon, please register on the site.

Join us for a pre OKFest get-together for those of you who are already in Helsinki and hungry for some Mexican food and good company! The restaurant is easy-going, and It is ok to only buy a beer if you don't want to eat. 

The Santa Fe restaurant is in the center of Helsinki at 15 Aleksanterinkatu (about 500 m. from the railway station). No table reservation needed: http://www.rafla.fi/santafe/en/

Citizen scientists contribute massive amounts of time and data to advance scientific knowledge, from online projects like Galaxy Zoo and Planet Hunters at the Zooniverse to tracking ladybirds and butterflies. Join us for a discussion about the potential of citizen science in the digital age and specifically the role that openess plays in terms of the data, the research process itself and the communication of results. 

There will be a particular focus on the participatory aspect of citizen science and direc t interaction with the public that is missing from discussions about openess in other areas of research. 

Points for discussion include: Is there a moral imperative for researchers who use citizen sourced data to make that data and resulting publications publicly available? Is open participation the most important thing? Are there privacy issues concerning citizen science projects which will limit potential opening up of data?

Speakers:

Jenny Molloy, Open Knowledge Foundation
Chris Lintott, Citizen Science Project Lead at Zooniverse, University of Oxford
Matthias Stevens, Extreme Citizen Science Research Group, UCL
results.short_description: Citizen Science: The Role of Openness

results.description: Switzerland's next Open Data Camp brings together thinkers and makers around the topic of Open Health Data. Register now and help accelerate openness, innovation and efficiency in health services: http://make.opendata.ch

Switzerland's next Open Data Camp brings together thinkers and makers around the topic of Open Health Data. Register now and help accelerate openness, innovation and efficiency in health services: http://make.opendata.ch

Come to meet the Czech opendata community face to face. 


Programme:
 - Open Knowledge Festival (http://okfestival.org/) is the world's biggest open data event - Czech participants will come to share their experience and inspiration
-  http://www.nasstat.cz/- Czech opendata platform and its development
- Czech chapter of Open Knowledge Foundation http://cz.okfn.org/

 
The programme is open to any contribution, if you want to prepare a lightning talk, a presentation etc. feel free to do so

#opendatacz
results.short_description: Prague open data meetup #3 - sharing experience from Open Knowledge Festival

results.description:
We're looking for ways to support global annotation, web caching, and shared data initiatives.  Some local folks are helping launch an Awesome Knowledge chapter.  

Come hang out and share your own projects and ideas.  And suggest dates for future meetings in this thread, esp. if you can't make October 3.

Things to touch on in the first meeting:
* clusters of local OK and open data interest, 
* projects that we could draw into the fold or help work better with one another,
* what we'd like to see change in the coming year.  
* logistics of having a local group: possible hosts an sponsors, future meetings

I'll bring snacks: tell me what you'd like :)

Interested in open data, open content or the public domain? If so we'd love to meet you! 

Open Knowledge Foundation Co-Founder Rufus Pollock will be hosting the first OKFN meetup in San Francisco.

If you know other people or organisations who might be interested in coming along, we'd be grateful if you could help to spread the word.

Meetup abierto para los miembros de OKFN list o personas interesadas en las actividades de la OKFN en España. 
Nos reunimos en Madrid con vistas a la reunión en el FCForum donde vienen Kat y Daniel (Dietrich) de la OKFN. 
Hablaremos de nuestro futuro y de las actividades a lanzar. 
Y despediremos a Alvaro que se nos va a Chile :-D
y nuestros estatutos, nuestro roadmap, iniciativas que podemos lanzar, eventos en los que participar y la realidad legislativa... con unas cervezitas

The Bodleian Libraries is building a new 21st century digital republic of letters, extending Thomas Bodleys original vision for his library to open up collections to all who need them. The Libraries are creating digital open access collections, and are using web technologies to provide free access to Oxford research publications, research data and bibliographic data.

Find out how the libraries are helping Oxford researchers make their science open and bring your questions!

Presenters:
Dr Wolfram Horstmann: Associate Director, Digital Library Programmes and Information Technology

Alena Ptak-Danchak: Keeper of Scientific Books and Head of Bodleian Science and Medical Libraries

Sally Rumsey: Digital Collections Development Manager

Neil Jefferies: Research and Development Project Manager

Topics presented for discussion include:
An overview of the Bodleian and openness in the context of the University
The view from the sciences
ORA and open publications and theses
Open data, DataBank and DataFinder
The technologies behind our services

Part of Open Access Week! See more activities here http://www.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/__data/assets/pdf_file/0019/111925/Poster-2012-v.2-11102012.pdf
results.short_description: The Bodleian on Open Science: Bodleys Republic of [open] letters'

results.description: OKFN Meet-ups are friendly and informal evenings for people to get together and talk about open data. Join us to meet local open data enthusiasts whether your interest is government, science, economics, mapping, international development or more!

Ohjelma ja lisätiedot: http://fi.okfn.org/meetups/avoin-data-2012/

Mitä: Avoin Data 2012 iltapäiväseminaari

Milloin: Keskiviikko 24.10.2012, klo 11:30-17:30

Missä: Sitra , Itämerentori 2

Ilmoittautumislinkki http://avoindata2012.eventbrite.com 

Tilaisuus on maksuton, ennakkoilmoittautumiset 20.10.2012 mennessä tai siihen asti, kun paikkoja riittää.

Huom: Tilaisuuteen mahtuu vain 50 ensimmäiseksi ilmoittautunutta, mikäli olet ilmoittautunut, mutta et pääse paikalle, niin ole ystävällinen ja lähetä peruutusilmoitus osoitteeseen: antti.poikola [a] gmail.com

Sometime in November: we'll have visitors from OKFN UK who want to get involved, and bring some love from the recent OK Festival with them.  Let's have a meeting with them while they are in town.

Date are flexible; please note when you can make a meeting in the comments.
results.short_description: Meet & greet, identify project clusters with local interest

results.description:
Open Interests Europe brings together developers, designers, activists, journalists and other geeks for two days of learning, fun, intense hacking and app building.

How EU money is spent is an issue that concerns everyone who pays taxes to the EU. As the influence of Brussels lobbyists grows, it is increasingly important to draw the connections between lobbying, policy-making and funding. Journalists and activists need browsable databases, tools and platforms to investigate lobbyists influence and where the money goes in the EU. Join us and help build these tools!

The Hackathon challenges include Lobbying Transparency and Fish Subsidies.

Organised by the Open Knowledge Foundation and the European Journalism Centre, sponsored by Knight-Mozilla OpenNews.

For more details, please see the event website: 
http://okfnlabs.org/events/hackdays/lobbying.html

and register at http://openinterests.eventbrite.com
results.short_description: Open Interests Europe Hackathon in London
